newsitem.title: GREECE: Ergobank will not bid for Bank of Central Greece.
newsitem.headline: Ergobank will not bid for Bank of Central Greece.

text.p: Greek ErgoBank, the country's second largest private bank, will not bid for a majority stake in Bank of Central Greece that state Agricultural Bank of Greece has tendered, it said in a statement.

ErgoBank cited an extra condition to retain the same number of jobs at the Bank of Central Greece in justifying its decision not to submit a bid and said its business plan would have increased employment at the bank.
It was among eight Greek and foreign banks that expressed interest in buying a majority stake in Bank of Central Greece.
Agricultural Bank owns about 56 percent of common registered shares and 21 percent of preferred registered.

Bank of Central Greece was founded in 1936 and was listed on the Athens bourse in 1991. It has a network of 22 branches and employs 580 persons. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
